intro: Pulsatilla patens lusus atroviolacea, commonly known as the dark violet pasqueflower, is a rare and striking member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves appear. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant is known for its short stature and delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
